messages.message:
@Abhishek Adupa @Anil From what we discussed earlier, I looked into whether we can achieve both splitting and selectively showing pages from a PDF while also achieving feature parity with what we currently have - the good news is that I think that we can:
• We can use the library `react-pdf` to do a bulk of the work (this is already in our codebase)
• We can replicate scaling and panning with our own JS built on top
• The hardest part is showing boxes for provenance, but it should be fine. I'm not sure how provenance works nowadays but we might run into issues with the x and y coordinates of the boxes to show (since now we're not splitting up the PDFs, we're just hiding some pages, we can't have provenance use the x and y coordinates using the top left of the PDF), but hopefully we can change how those coordinates are calculated if we run into issues.
• react-pdf would also work for showing thumbnails as well - we'll just scale PDF pages to a small size. Maybe there could be a performance issue if there are a ton of PDFs though, but it's hard to tell this early on
